alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Monroe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:52PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, northeastern Upson and southeastern Lamar Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Yatesville, or 11 miles south of Barnesville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Barnesville, Forsyth, Yatesville, Culloden, Aldora, Redbone, Logtown, Goggins, Collier, Russellville, Johnstonville and Brent. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
